Sun of Faith - English: Chapter 1. How the Bodhisattva Becomes the Divine Son Shvetaketu in Tushita
Eons upon eons ago, when human life could last up to twenty thousand years, the Blessed One Kashyapa appeared in the world.
Secondary/Tertiary Canonical Source(s) (: Lhasa Kangyur dkar chag (H 809: vol. 100, folio/line 58b.4-5)
Scene working notes: dkar chag: "skye dgu'i tshe lo nyi khri'i dus rgyal po kri kris wa ra Na sir sa gzhi skyong ba'i tshe rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung 'jig rten du byon/"

Sun of Faith - English: Our teacher was a brahmin youth named Uttara then.
Then he was reborn, and became the bodhisattva Shvetaketu, the teacher of the gods in Tushita.
Secondary/Tertiary Canonical Source(s) (: Lhasa Kangyur dkar chag (H 809: vol. 100, folio/line 109a.3-4)
Scene working notes: See passage in the Lhasa bka' 'gyur dkar chag: "bram ze khye'u bla ma nas tshe 'phos te dga' ldan gyi lha'i bu dam pa tog dkar zhes bya ba skye ba gcig thogs kyi byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bzung nas rtsod ldan tshe lo brgya par thug gi bar dga' ldan gyi lha'i gzhal med khang yon tan dang rgyan gyi bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par lha rnams la chos ston cing bzhugs pa'i tshe [...]" (H 809: vol. 100, folio/line 109a.3-109a.4)

Sun of Faith - English: He followed the ways of bodhisattvas in their final life, and taught the authentic Dharma to the principal gods and the other inhabitants of Tushita to lead them to spiritual maturity.
Inscription - English: The Bodhisattva teaches dharma to the gods
Secondary/Tertiary Canonical Source(s) (: Lhasa Kangyur dkar chag (H 809: vol. 100, folio/line 109a.3-4)

Sun of Faith - English: From then until the era in which humans lived only one hundred years, Shvetaketu occupied that same body in the Tushita realm.
Secondary/Tertiary Canonical Source(s) (: Lhasa Kangyur dkar chag (H 809: vol. 100, folio/line 109a.3-4)
